questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).

Assertion (A) : At 10$$^\circ$$C, the density of a 5 M solution of KCl [atomic masses of K & Cl are 39 & 35.5 g mol$$-$$1 respectively], is 'x' g ml$$-$$1. The solution is cooled to $$-$$21$$^\circ$$C. The molality of the solution will remain unchanged.

Reason (R) : The molality of a solution does not change with temperature as mass remains unaffected with temperature.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
options.B: Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).

questions.question:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). 
Assertion (A) : At 10$$^\circ$$C, the density of a 5 M solution of KCl [atomic masses of K & Cl are 39 & 35.5 g mol^{$$-$$1} respectively], is 'x' g ml^{$$-$$1}. The solution is cooled to $$-$$21$$^\circ$$C. The molality of the solution will remain unchanged. 
Reason (R) : The molality of a solution does not change with temperature as mass remains unaffected with temperature. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.question_text:
Based upon VSEPR theory, match the shape (geometry) of the molecules in List-I with the molecules in List-II and select the most appropriate option.


.tg  {border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0;}
.tg td{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg .tg-1wig{font-weight:bold;text-align:left;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-0lax{text-align:left;vertical-align:top}









  
    
    List - I
(Shape)
    
    List - II
(Molecules)
  


  
    (A)
    T-shaped
    (I)
    XeF$$_4$$
  
  
    (B)
    Trigonal planar
    (II)
    SF$$_4$$
  
  
    (C)
    Square planar
    (III)
    ClF$$_3$$
  
  
    (D)
    See-saw
    (IV)
    BF$$_3$$

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).

Assertion (A) : The ionic radii of O2$$-$$ and Mg2+ are same.

Reason (R) : Both O2$$-$$ and Mg2+ are isoelectronic species.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
options.B: Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).

questions.question:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). 
Assertion (A) : The ionic radii of O^{2$$-$$} and Mg^{2+} are same. 
Reason (R) : Both O^{2$$-$$} and Mg^{2+} are isoelectronic species. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : In Hofmann degradation reaction, the migration of only an alkyl group takes place from carbonyl carbon of the amide to the nitrogen atom.

Statement II : The group is migrated in Hofmann degradation reaction to electron deficient atom.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
options.C: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
options.D: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

questions.question:
Given below are two statements : 
Statement I : In Hofmann degradation reaction, the migration of only an alkyl group takes place from carbonyl carbon of the amide to the nitrogen atom. 
Statement II : The group is migrated in Hofmann degradation reaction to electron deficient atom. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

questions.question_text: L-isomer of a compound 'A' (C4H8O4) gives a positive test with [Ag(NH3)2]+. Treatment of 'A' with acetic anhydride yields triacetate derivative. Compound 'A' produces an optically active compound (B) and an optically inactive compound (C) on treatment with bromine water and HNO3 respectively. Compound (A) is :
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: L-isomer of a compound 'A' (C_{4}H_{8}O_{4}) gives a positive test with [Ag(NH_{3})_{2}]^{+}. Treatment of 'A' with acetic anhydride yields triacetate derivative. Compound 'A' produces an optically active compound (B) and an optically inactive compound (C) on treatment with bromine water and HNO_{3} respectively. Compound (A) is :

questions.question_text:
If the uncertainty in velocity and position of a minute particle in space are, 2.4 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$26 (m s$$-$$1) and 10$$-$$7 (m) respectively. The mass of the particle in g is ____________. (Nearest integer)

(Given : h = 6.626 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 Js)

questions.question:
If the uncertainty in velocity and position of a minute particle in space are, 2.4 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$26} (m s^{$$-$$1}) and 10^{$$-$$7} (m) respectively. The mass of the particle in g is ____________. (Nearest integer) 
(Given : h = 6.626 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$34} Js)

questions.question_text:
2 g of a non-volatile non-electrolyte solute is dissolved in 
 200 g of two different solvents A and B whose ebullioscopic constants are in the ratio of 1 : 8. The elevation in boiling points of A and B are in the ratio $${x \over y}$$ (x : y). The value of y is ______________. (Nearest integer)

questions.question_text:
2NOCl(g) $$\rightleftharpoons$$ 2NO(g) + Cl2(g)

In an experiment, 2.0 moles of NOCl was placed in a one-litre flask and the concentration of NO after equilibrium established, was found to be 0.4 mol/L. The equilibrium constant at 30$$^\circ$$C is ______________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$4.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
2NOCl(g) $$\rightleftharpoons$$ 2NO(g) + Cl_{2}(g) 
In an experiment, 2.0 moles of NOCl was placed in a one-litre flask and the concentration of NO after equilibrium established, was found to be 0.4 mol/L. The equilibrium constant at 30$$^\circ$$C is ______________ $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$4}.

questions.question_text: The limiting molar conductivities of NaI, NaNO3 and AgNO3 are 12.7, 12.0 and 13.3 mS m2 mol$$-$$1, respectively (all at 25$$^\circ$$C). The limiting molar conductivity of AgI at this temperature is ____________ mS m2 mol$$-$$1.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: The limiting molar conductivities of NaI, NaNO_{3} and AgNO_{3} are 12.7, 12.0 and 13.3 mS m^{2} mol^{$$-$$1}, respectively (all at 25$$^\circ$$C). The limiting molar conductivity of AgI at this temperature is ____________ mS m^{2} mol^{$$-$$1}.

questions.question_text:
The rate constant for a first order reaction is given by the following equation:

$$\ln k = 33.24 - {{2.0 \times {{10}^4}\,K} \over T}$$

The activation energy for the reaction is given by ____________ kJ mol$$-$$1. (In nearest integer) (Given : R = 8.3 J K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1)
questions.subject: Chemistry

(A) Cu(II) complexes are always paramagnetic.

(B) Cu(I) complexes are generally colourless

(C) Cu(I) is easily oxidized

(D) In Fehling solution, the active reagent has Cu(I)

questions.question: A girl standing on road holds her umbrella at 45$$^\circ$$ with the vertical to keep the rain away. If she starts running without umbrella with a speed of 15$$\sqrt2$$ kmh^{$$-$$1}, the rain drops hit her head vertically. The speed of rain drops with respect to the moving girl is :

questions.question_text: A silver wire has a mass (0.6 $$\pm$$ 0.006) g, radius (0.5 $$\pm$$ 0.005) mm and length (4 $$\pm$$ 0.04) cm. The maximum percentage error in the measurement of its density will be :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A silver wire has a mass (0.6 $$\pm$$ 0.006) g, radius (0.5 $$\pm$$ 0.005) mm and length (4 $$\pm$$ 0.04) cm. The maximum percentage error in the measurement of its density will be :

questions.question_text: A system of two blocks of masses m = 2 kg and M = 8 kg is placed on a smooth table as shown in figure. The coefficient of static friction between two blocks is 0.5. The maximum horizontal force F that can be applied to the block of mass M so that the blocks move together will be :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A system of two blocks of masses m = 2 kg and M = 8 kg is placed on a smooth table as shown in figure. The coefficient of static friction between two blocks is 0.5. The maximum horizontal force F that can be applied to the block of mass M so that the blocks move together will be :

questions.question_text: Two blocks of masses 10 kg and 30 kg are placed on the same straight line with coordinates (0, 0) cm and (x, 0) cm respectively. The block of 10 kg is moved on the same line through a distance of 6 cm towards the other block. The distance through which the block of 30 kg must be moved to keep the position of centre of mass of the system unchanged is :
questions.subject: Physics

options.B: 2 cm away from the 10 kg block
options.D: 4 cm away from the 10 kg block

questions.question: Two blocks of masses 10 kg and 30 kg are placed on the same straight line with coordinates (0, 0) cm and (x, 0) cm respectively. The block of 10 kg is moved on the same line through a distance of 6 cm towards the other block. The distance through which the block of 30 kg must be moved to keep the position of centre of mass of the system unchanged is :

questions.question_text: A 72 $$\Omega$$ galvanometer is shunted by a resistance of 8 $$\Omega$$. The percentage of the total current which passes through the galvanometer is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A 72 $$\Omega$$ galvanometer is shunted by a resistance of 8 $$\Omega$$. The percentage of the total current which passes through the galvanometer is :

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : The law of gravitation holds good for any pair of bodies in the universe.

Statement II : The weight of any person becomes zero when the person is at the centre of the earth.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
options.D: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

questions.question:
Given below are two statements : 
Statement I : The law of gravitation holds good for any pair of bodies in the universe. 
Statement II : The weight of any person becomes zero when the person is at the centre of the earth. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.

questions.question_text:
What percentage of kinetic energy of a moving particle is transferred to a stationary particle when it strikes the stationary particle of 5 times its mass?

(Assume the collision to be head-on elastic collision)

questions.question_text:
The susceptibility of a paramagnetic material is 99. The permeability of the material in Wb/A-m, is :

[Permeability of free space $$\mu$$0 = 4$$\pi$$ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$7 Wb/A-m]

questions.question_text:
The current flowing through an ac circuit is given by

I = 5 sin(120$$\pi$$t)A

How long will the current take to reach the peak value starting from zero?
questions.subject: Physics

  overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}

    (iii)

questions.question_text: A 220 V, 50 Hz AC source is connected to a 25 V, 5 W lamp and an additional resistance R in series (as shown in figure) to run the lamp at its peak brightness, then the value of R (in ohm) will be _____________.

questions.question_text: In Young's double slit experiment the two slits are 0.6 mm distance apart. Interference pattern is observed on a screen at a distance 80 cm from the slits. The first dark fringe is observed on the screen directly opposite to one of the slits. The wavelength of light will be ____________ nm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In Young's double slit experiment the two slits are 0.6 mm distance apart. Interference pattern is observed on a screen at a distance 80 cm from the slits. The first dark fringe is observed on the screen directly opposite to one of the slits. The wavelength of light will be ____________ nm.

questions.question_text:
A beam of monochromatic light is used to excite the electron in Li+ + from the first orbit to the third orbit. The wavelength of monochromatic light is found to be x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$10 m. The value of x is ___________.

[Given hc = 1242 eV nm]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:

[Given hc = 1242 eV nm]

questions.question_text: The current density in a cylindrical wire of radius 4 mm is 4 $$\times$$ 106 Am$$-$$2. The current through the outer portion of the wire between radial distances $${R \over 2}$$ and R is ____________ $$\pi$$ A.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The current density in a cylindrical wire of radius 4 mm is 4 $$\times$$ 10^{6} Am^{$$-$$2}. The current through the outer portion of the wire between radial distances $${R \over 2}$$ and R is ____________ $$\pi$$ A.

questions.question_text: A capacitor of capacitance 50 pF is charged by 100 V source. It is then connected to another uncharged identical capacitor. Electrostatic energy loss in the process is ___________ nJ.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A capacitor of capacitance 50 pF is charged by 100 V source. It is then connected to another uncharged identical capacitor. Electrostatic energy loss in the process is ___________ nJ.

questions.question_text: The area of cross-section of a large tank is 0.5 m2. It has a narrow opening near the bottom having area of cross-section 1 cm2. A load of 25 kg is applied on the water at the top  in the tank. Neglecting the speed of water in the tank, the velocity of the water, coming out of the opening at the time when the height of water level in the tank is 40 cm above the bottom, will be ___________ cms$$-$$1. [Take g = 10 ms$$-$$2]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The area of cross-section of a large tank is 0.5 m^{2}. It has a narrow opening near the bottom having area of cross-section 1 cm^{2}. A load of 25 kg is applied on the water at the top  in the tank. Neglecting the speed of water in the tank, the velocity of the water, coming out of the opening at the time when the height of water level in the tank is 40 cm above the bottom, will be ___________ cms^{$$-$$1}. [Take g = 10 ms^{$$-$$2}]

questions.question_text: A pendulum of length 2 m consists of a wooden bob of mass 50 g. A bullet of mass 75 g is fired towards the stationary bob with a speed v. The bullet emerges out of the bob with a speed $${v \over 3}$$ and the bob just completes the vertical circle. The value of v is ___________ ms$$-$$1. (if g = 10 m/s2).
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A pendulum of length 2 m consists of a wooden bob of mass 50 g. A bullet of mass 75 g is fired towards the stationary bob with a speed v. The bullet emerges out of the bob with a speed $${v \over 3}$$ and the bob just completes the vertical circle. The value of v is ___________ ms^{$$-$$1}. (if g = 10 m/s^{2}).
